content.description:
Image 1

FRESCO PAINTED ON THE OUTER WALL OF THE MOLDOVITA MONASTERY IN ROMANIA DEPICTING THE OTTOMAN SIEGE OF CONSTANTINOPLE IN 1453

The monastery was built in 1532.

Image 2

NAKKASH OSMAN, OTTOMAN COURT PAINTER, MINIATURE DEPICTING AN OTTOMAN SIEGE OF A EUROPEAN CITY DURING THE REIGN OF SULTAN SÜLEYMAN I (1520–1566)

The image was produced for an official history of the Ottoman Empire compiled circa 1585.
content.question: The Ottoman practices shown in the two images directly contributed to which of the following developments before 1600 ?

choices.label: A series of Ottoman defeats in wars against an expanding Russian Empire
Large-scale Ottoman conquests in the Middle East and North Africa
Weakening of the Ottoman economy as the empire failed to keep pace with an industrializing Europe
The consolidation of Sunni Islam as the state religion of the Ottoman Empire

content.answer: Large-scale Ottoman conquests in the Middle East and North Africa

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
